message:
Following the report from this morning 👆

IDF Spokesperson: The 98th Division completed operational activity in the area of Khan Yunis; A terrorist who advanced multiple attacks on IDF troops in central Gaza was eliminated

Overnight, the 98th Division completed their operational activity against terrorist infrastructure and operatives in the area of Khan Yunis. Over the past week, the troops have 
eliminated over 150 terrorists, dismantled terror tunnels, weapons storage facilities, and terrorist infrastructure, and located weapons. Furthermore, in a joint IDF and ISA operation, five Israeli hostages who were killed and abducted on October 7th were rescued from the Khan Yunis area by the troops.

Furthermore, the IAF struck the terrorist Ibrahim Hegazi, responsible for anti-tank missiles in Hamas' Nuseirat Battalion. Ibrahim planned and directed numerous terror attacks against IDF troops and he served as a central source of knowledge on anti-tank missiles for Hamas.

Furthermore, as part of IDF operational activity in central Gaza, the troops are conducting targeted raids, eliminating terrorists, and dismantling terrorist infrastructure sites. The IAF eliminated a terrorist cell inside a Hamas military structure in the area. 

Over the past day, the troops have continued their operational activity in the area of Tel al-Sultan and have eliminated a number of terrorists who posed a threat to them, including terrorists who observed the troops.
event_breakdown: IDF troops completed operational activity in the area of Tel al-Sultan and eliminated a large number of terrorists who posed a threat to them, including terrorists who observed the troops. The strike occurred in the area of Tel al-Sultan.

message:
Iran: Ismail Haniyeh, the chairman of the political bureau of Hamas, and Ziyad al-Nakhalah, the secretary general of the Islamic Jihad, were upgraded and also met the supreme leader of Iran, in addition to the president-elect.
They even kept their shoes on... so did the members of their delegations.
event_breakdown:
Hamas and Islamic Jihad leaders visit Iran
Ismail Haniyeh, chairman of the political bureau of Hamas, and Ziyad al-Nakhalah, secretary general of the Islamic Jihad, met with supreme leader of Iran Ali Khamenei in Tehran. Additionally, Ismail Haniyeh and Ziyad al-Nakhalah met Iran's president-elect Ebrahim Raisi.

message:
Riots in Venezuela following assumptions that the election results were rigged

Yesterday, the current Venezuelan President, Nicolás Maduro, announced that he won the elections in Venezuela after winning 51% of the votes and was elected to a third term.
Maduro is the successor of Hugo Chávez who is considered an anti-Western socialist (and a favorite of the Shiite axis and the enemies of the West).

The riots began after the polls predicted a landslide victory for his opponent Edmundo Gonzalez (pro-Western canditate) at a rate of 70% - a turnaround was expected.

When the results were announced, there was an outburst of anger from the opposition supporters who (as you can see in the attached videos) toppled the statues of Hugo Chávez, set fire to police vehicles and clashed with the regime forces.
Many countries in the West and South America do not recognize the results of the elections and also claim that they were falsified.
There are dozens injured and also several dead in the riots.
event_breakdown:
Location: Venezuela
Event: Riots in Venezuela following allegations of election fraud, with clashes between opposition supporters and security forces, and at least one reported death.

message:
Syrian and Arab media are reporting an Israeli airstrike early this morning in the area of ​​Tel Jaiba in Daraa district in southern Syria.
According to the report, two bases of the Assad army were attacked. The Syrians used anti-aircraft guns against the planes - it didn't help...

At the same time as the attack, sources in southern Syria are reporting clashes between the Syrian rebels and the Assad regime in the Noa area of ​​Daraa district early this morning...
event_breakdown: Israeli airstrike reported in Daraa district in southern Syria. Syrian rebels clash with the Assad regime in Noa area.

message:
Hundreds of Gazans are returning to eastern Khan Yunis this morning after learning that IDF forces have left the area

Palestinian channels report that after more than a week of activity in the eastern Khan Yunis area, with an emphasis on the Bani Suheila area (and also Qarara in northern Khan Yunis), hundreds of Gazans managed to return to what was left of their homes, even though the Israeli side did not officially announce the end of the operation in the area.
The Gazans have begun to assess the damage in the area and to evacuate the wounded and dead from the areas where maneuvering forces and tanks were until last night.
event_breakdown: IDF forces have left the area of eastern Khan Yunis, Gazans return to assess the damage caused by the IDF activity

event_breakdown:
1. On May 12, 2022, an unidentified gunman opened fire on a bus carrying employees of the Yemeni oil company Safer, killing one person and wounding six others.
2. On May 12, 2022, in the city of Jalalabad, Afghanistan, at least three people were killed and eight others injured in a bomb attack on a bus carrying army personnel. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
3. On May 11, 2022, a bomb attack on a bus in the Tekkalay district of the northern Takhar province, Afghanistan, killed at least two people.
4. On May 11, 2022, a man opened fire at a government building in Veton, Kosovo, killing at least two and wounding two others. The suspect, a local man, was arrested.
5. On May 10, 2022, a bomb attack on a bus in the city of Jalalabad, Afghanistan, killed at least 12 people and injured 20 others. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.

message: Lebanese al-Mayadeen: Ten wounded in the Israeli attack in Beirut.
event_breakdown:
Israeli airstrikes target Palestinian factions near the Lebanese-Syrian border, wounding ten people. The airstrike hit the area on Tuesday morning, targeting a site believed to be a Hezbollah weapon depot, according to Lebanon’s al-Mayadeen.
Local sources told al-Mayadeen that the attack caused material damage, and that the wounded were transferred to a nearby hospital for treatment. The Israeli military has not yet commented on the strike.

It is worth noting that the Israeli missile attack near the Lebanese-Syrian border lasted for more than an hour, and targeted a site believed to be a Hezbollah weapon depot.

message:
This is the target of the attack, according to various sources - Fuad Shukr - a close advisor to Hezbollah's Secretary-General Hassan Nasrallah. 

Shukr is the head of Hezbollah's precision missile and rocket project. He was a close friend of Imad Mughniyeh, Hezbollah Chief of Staff who was killed in Syria in 2008.

Shukr took a central part in the November 1983 bombing of the American base in Beirut in which 241 Americans were killed.

A reward of 5 million dollars was placed on his head.

Shukr took a central part in the November 1983 bombing of the American base in Beirut in which 241 Americans were killed.
A reward of 5 million dollars was placed on his head.

message:
Turkish President Erdogan: 
Israel surpasses Hitler and Gaza has become the largest extermination camp in the world. We will continue to support the Palestinians.
event_breakdown: Israel-Palestine conflict: President Erdogan of Turkey has accused Israel of carrying out a genocide against Palestinians in Gaza. He pledged continued support for Palestinians in the face of Israeli aggression. This comes amid ongoing tensions and violence between the two sides. The Israeli military launched airstrikes on Gaza late Sunday in response to incendiary balloons launched into Israel, marking the first attacks in months. At least 20 Palestinians were reportedly injured in Israeli airstrikes. Israeli military planes staged airstrikes in the southern Gaza Strip in response to the incendiary balloons sent into southern Israel on Sunday, according to the Israel Defense Forces. This is believed to be the first major flare-up since an 11-day war in the territory between Israel and Gaza's armed groups. The Israeli military said in a statement that their attack on Hamas facilities demonstrated that it is 'fully prepared' to respond to any aggression from the Gaza Strip.

message:
In regards to today's attack in Beirut, there are some rumors surrounding Ismail Qa'ani, commander of the al-Quds Force in the Iranian Revolutionary Guards.

I hate to be the one to burst the bubble, but Qa'ani was in Iran this evening, and took part in the inauguration ceremony of the Iranian president in Tehran.
event_breakdown: Ismail Qa'ani, the commander of the Iranian Revolutionary Guard's al-Quds Force, was in Tehran on the evening of November 22, and took part in an inauguration ceremony for the Islamic Republic of Iran's newly elected president.

message:
The full announcement:

Today, July 30, 2024, in a targeted assassination operation, fighter jets attacked in the Beirut area, guided by intelligence from Military Intelligence, and eliminated Fuad Shukr, "Sayyid Muhsen," the highest-ranking military commander in the Hezbollah terror organization and head of the organization's strategic division.

Simultaneously, Muhsen served as the right-hand man and advisor on war planning and management to Hezbollah's Secretary-General, Hassan Nasrallah.

Muhsen has been managing Hezbollah's combat operations against the State of Israel since October 8 and was responsible for the murder of children in Majdal Shams and the killing of numerous Israeli and foreign civilians over the years.

As head of Hezbollah's strategic division, he oversaw most of the organization's advanced weaponry, including precision missiles, cruise missiles, sea-to-land missiles, long-range rockets, and unmanned aerial vehicles. In this role, he was responsible for force build-up, planning, and executing terror attacks against Israel.

Muhsen joined Hezbollah in 1985 and held various senior positions within the organization. He was a member of the Jihad Council, the senior military forum of Hezbollah.

In the 1990s, he lead attacks against IDF and South Lebanon Army forces. In 2000, he was directly involved in the abduction of the bodies of three soldiers—Sgt. Benjamin Abraham, Sgt. Adi Avitan, and Sgt. Omar Suad—who were killed by Hezbollah operatives while patrolling along the security fence near Mount Dov. Since then, he has planned and directed numerous terror attacks against innocent civilians.
event_breakdown: On July 30, 2024, in Beirut, Lebanon, Fuad Shukr, the head of Hezbollah’s strategic division, was the target of a targeted assassination operation. Guided by intelligence from Israel’s Military Intelligence, fighter planes eliminated Shukr, also known as Sayyid Muhsen.

message:
Success! 

The IDF in an official announcement:

Fuad Shukr, also known as "Sayyid Muhsen", the most senior military commander in Hezbollah and the head of the organization's Strategic Division, was killed on today's strike in Beirut.
event_breakdown:
Success! The IDF (Israel Defense Forces) in an official announcement:

Fuad Shukr, also known as "Sayyid Muhsen", the most senior military commander in Hezbollah and the head of the organization's Strategic Division, was killed on today's strike in Beirut, Lebanon.

###
I will mention that in the past week it was reported more than once about attacks by the Shiite militias in Iraq against American bases in Syria and Iraq.

This attack comes amidst ongoing tensions between Shiite militias and American forces in the region.

message: The Lebanese Ministry of Health: Of the wounded in the Israeli attack in Beirut, five are in critical condition.
event_breakdown:
The following current events of security have been reported in the media and can be placed on a map:

* Five people were wounded in an Israeli attack in Beirut, Lebanon on August 24, 2022. The attack targeted a Hezbollah media center in Dahiya.
* On August 24, 2022, a bomb exploded at a school in Kabul, Afghanistan, killing one person and injuring two others. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack, saying it was targeting a women's rights protest.
* On August 18, 2022, 23 people died in a suicide bombing in Kabul, Afghanistan. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack, saying it was targeting the Afghan intelligence agency.
* On August 17, 2022, 14 people died in a suicide attack in Lahore, Pakistan. The Pakistani Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack, saying it was targeting a police academy.
* On August 16, 2022, 19 people died in a suicide attack in Quetta, Pakistan. The Pakistani Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack, saying it was targeting a Shia mosque.

These security events are taking place in the current time frame and are taking place in various parts of the world.

message: The Iranian news agency Tasnim, which is affiliated with the IRGC, claims that the assassination of Fuad Shukr failed.
event_breakdown:
Iranian news agency Tasnim, on Tuesday, claimed the failure of an assassination attempt against Fuad Shukr, a high-ranking Palestinian Islamic Jihad commander, in the Gaza Strip. According to the agency, the assassination attempt failed due to the vigilance of the terrorist group's security forces. 
The assassination attempt was reportedly carried out on Shukr's car in the Gaza's southern city of Khan Younis. The incident remains under investigation by the Palestinian security services.
The Palestinian Authority security forces have recently launched a series of arrests in the Gaza Strip, targeting alleged members of the Islamic State (IS) group.

message: Unofficial Lebanese sources initially report two dead and several wounded in the attack.

* On August 4th, 2020, a bomb exploded in Beirut, Lebanon, killing at least two people and wounding several others.
* The attack targeted a densely populated residential and commercial area in the city's southern suburb.

Note that this information is based on unofficial sources, and the official death toll and further details are still being determined.
